definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Time is inclined to change those unfavorable memories into imaginary perfectness .
sentences.chinese: 时间将一些原来并不美好的记忆幻化成千古的完美。

sentences.english: The freeboard of network economy period make, unreal changes the hubble-bubble that gives countless dimly discernible.
sentences.chinese: 网络经济的超高期许，幻化出无数缥缈的泡泡。

sentences.english: The snow changed the valley into a strange glazed world.
sentences.chinese: 雪后的山谷幻化成一个奇特的琉璃世界。

sentences.english: Kan's 4 days workshop will be focused about Butoh transformation on the stage for the audience.
sentences.chinese: 桂勘的4天工作坊会着重讲解舞踏的“幻化”。

sentences.english: All things will change from void to existence, from emptiness to fullness, from birth to death, being deceitful and untrue.
sentences.chinese: 一切事相随时变迁幻化起起灭灭，是虚假不真实的。

sentences.english: The world is the ever changing foam that floats on the surface of a sea of silence.
sentences.chinese: 世界是幻化无休的泡沫，浮荡于静默之海。

sentences.english: At night, the chrysalises light up, to keep people's dreams forever illuminated.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚蝶蛹幻化成灯，好让梦想永不打烊。

sentences.english: Shadow, of your face refeleCts in the water, with flower suddenly blooning.
sentences.chinese: 水里面幻化出你的脸，花，忽然开了。

sentences.english: The world is the everchanging foam that floats on the surface of a sea of silence.
sentences.chinese: 世界是幻化无休的泡沫，浮荡于静默之海。

definition: human shape/in human form/of human appearance/doll/puppet
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
the real body (of Buddha or a God)/true effigy
to spare time for a separate task/doppelgänger/sockpuppet (Internet slang)
to change into/to turn into/to become
to condense/to coagulate/coacervation (i.e. form tiny droplets)/aggregation/coherent
